item.title: Indian stock market caught between tariff and reform: What should be your strategy?

review.headline_rewrite: Indian stock market caught between tariff and reform: What should be your strategy?
bullets: The full impact of these measures on consolidated fiscal policy in the short term has to be reviewed.
If tariff tensions persist, India’s GDP growth could moderate by 50–100 basis points, with a consequent drag on earnings per share (EPS) growth in
The impact stems from the significant exposure of several listed manufacturers to the US market, which may result in weaker demand and price cuts,
While the broader GDP effect may remain contained, the earlier projected growth line of 7–8% is likely to ease to around 6%.

item.title: NSE, BSE impose fine on MTNL over non-compliance with SEBI rules

review.headline_rewrite: NSE, BSE impose fine on MTNL over non-compliance with SEBI rules
bullets: State-run telecom firm Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd has been penalised by stock exchanges NSE and BSE for non-compliance with respect to composition of the
"MTNL has received Letter ...from NSE and...BSE regarding Non-Compliance with the provisions of Regulation...of SEBI (LODR) Regulations, 2015, respectively...

The penalty also includes non-compliance with the constitution of nomination and remuneration committee, constitution of stakeholder relationship committee and constitution of Risk management committee.
"The company is also requesting to NSE and BSE for waiver of fines," the filing said.
